name: regrade
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to separate people or things for a second, third, etc. time into different levels of quality, size, importance, etc.: Some of the farmers are now hiring private contractors to regrade the crop. Because of the extra responsibilities, the job was re-graded so that she received a significant increase in pay.
US (UK remark) to give a score to a student's piece of work for a second, third, etc. time: State education officials will probably re-grade the math tests. Go away and redo the assignment, then come back and I might regrade it.
More examplesFewer examplesFirst, photocopy a set of student papers early in the year, replace the names with random numbers, and regrade the papers after four or five months.No applicant shall be allowed to seek re-grading or any other review of the results of the examination.
